bioghist.p: Thomas Biddle (1827-1875) was a Secretary of the United States Legation to Brazil, under President Lincoln. In 1866 he was a U.S. Special Diplomatic Agent to Cuba and in 1871 he was appointed Minister Resident to Salvador, where he remained until 1873. Biddle was appointed Minister Resident to Ecuador in 1875 and died in Guyaquill while on his way to his post. His was married to Sarah F. White in 1861. They had one son, Caldwell Keppelle Biddle.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to Thomas Biddle. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence, much of it with William Ralston and Biddle's wife, Sarah; calling cards and dance cards, business cards, invitations and menus, sketches, and a watercolor drawing. The collection also contains genealogical notes apparently compiled by Biddle's daughter, Mrs. Francis Cabeen.
